page.title: 01Glen Brerachan
page.content: An attractive upland valley through which runs the A924 from Pitlochry to Kirkmichael. This road, frequently blocked by snow in winter, is the last east-west link before the Cairngorm Mountains to the north. Along the bottom of the valley there are cultivated fields but most of the area is rough grazing for sheep and at higher altitudes open moorland. Limited planting of coniferous trees has been carried out. The population is sparsed and is confined to isolated crofts and farms along the valley floor. Most of the inhabitants are connected with hill farming.
